intro: Meibomia sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its flowers are showy, often with five petals and a distinctive yellow or white color. Meibomia sonorae is adapted to arid environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures.
